DOC.brief_summary: Delirium are common after orthopedic surgery in the elderly and are directly associated with loss of independence, reduction in the quality of life and increased mortality. The cause of postoperative delirium still remains unclear and may be multifactorial. The aim of this retrospective study is to examine prevalence of postoperative delirium according to the use of dexmedetomidine or propofol in elderly patients undergoing orthopedic surgery under regional anesthesia.
DOC.criteria: Patients who underwent orthopedic surgery under regional anesthesia age of 65 years or greater General anesthesia age < 65 years central nervous system disease, including dementia and Parkinson's disease Patients who were not received sedation with propofol or dexmedetomidine during the operation
